definition: character book (i.e. school primer)
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write

sentences.english: Life is just like a wordless book, on which need you to write down the most beautiful words.
sentences.chinese: 人好像一本無字書，需自己寫上最美的文字。

sentences.english: Recorded in the words of their book "History of Zhou chapter" and named.
sentences.chinese: 因其着錄於字書《史籀篇》而得名。

sentences.english: I could read books very early in this way.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，我很早就會看字書了。

sentences.english: I read books, and Dad recommended books in written words to me intentionally.
sentences.chinese: 我看書，爸爸還有意向我推薦字書。

sentences.english: Yupian" is the first Chinese dictionary written in regular script."
sentences.chinese: 《玉篇》是中國古代第一部以楷書爲主要形體的字書。

definition: letter/also written 書札|书札
regular script (Chinese calligraphic style)
booklet/brochure/(old) book (made of bamboo strips tied together)
study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
rime dictionary (ancient type of Chinese dictionary that collates characters by tone and rhyme rather than by radical)
calligraphic style of Liu Gongquan
scripture hall (Buddhism)
phonetic component of a Chinese character
Chinese phonetics (concerned also with rhyme in poetry)
sound and meaning
writing up of official or judicial documents/pettifoggery

the Book of History, one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1], a compendium of documents which make up the oldest extant texts of Chinese history, from legendary times down to the time of Confucius, also known as 尚書經|尚书经[Shang4 shu1 jing1], 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], 書|书[Shu1]
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
old variant of 補缺|补缺[bu3 que1]
